contests.title: Amazon Nova AI Hackathon
contests.description: Welcome to the Amazon Nova AI Hackathon! Amazon Nova is a portfolio of foundation models and services that deliver frontier intelligence and industry-leading price performance. This is your chance to invent with freedom and build with Nova‚Äôs capabilities, including advanced reasoning, tool use, multimodal understanding, voice AI, and UI workflow automation. Nova 2 Lite, a fast, cost-effective reasoning model for everyday tasks. Nova 2 Sonic, a speech-to-speech model for conversational AI. Nova Act is a service to build and manage fleets of agents for automating production UI workflows with high reliability. Nova multimodal embeddings: A state-of-the-art multimodal embedding model. Join and build innovative Gen AI applications using Amazon Nova! Why Participate? Innovate with Next-Gen AI. Explore the frontiers of generative AI and apply Nova's differentiated features to solve real-world problems. Real-World Impact. Develop solutions that deliver measurable value for businesses or create meaningful benefits for communities. Compete for Prizes. With a prize pool of $40,000 in cash and $55,000 in AWS credits, your innovative projects could earn significant rewards. Learn and Grow. Access dedicated resources, code examples, technical documentation, virtual workshops, and office hours to support your journey. Showcase Your Skills. Gain recognition for your expertise and show everyone your hard work. Get Started Amazon Nova 2 developer guide for foundation models and for Nova Act Amazon Nova website More Resources to help you!

contests.title: GitLab AI Hackathon
contests.description: AI writes code. That's expected now. The real opportunity? Everything else. Planning. Security. Compliance. Deployments. These are the bottlenecks that slow teams down every day. And they're wide open for automation. We're opening up the GitLab Duo Agent Platform and inviting developers worldwide to build AI agents that help you and your team to build secure software faster. Not chatbots that answer questions. Agents that jump into workflows, respond to events, and take action on your behalf. Think of it as building a digital teammate for every developer using GitLab. Why Join? Be early: Get access to the GitLab Duo Agent Platform for the duration of the hackathon while it‚Äôs fresh! Learn it. Build on it. Shape it. Learn how to build agents that assist you with tedious tasks such as creating tests Learn how to build a flow of agents and orchestrate an entire team of purpose-built agents to build & deploy feature requests from creating, testing, security scanning to deployment. Make an impact: Your agent could ship to thousands of GitLab users. This isn't just a side project that sits in a repo. Win $65,000 in prizes. Compete for the Grand Prize or win one of our category prices Get Started Join Discord and get to know each other in #ai-hackathon. Explore GitLab Duo Agent Platform. Request Access to the GitLab AI Hackathon group. Learn how to create GitLab custom Agents. Learn how to create GitLab Flows. Discover what‚Äôs possible in our GitLab Duo prompt library.
contests.summary: AI writes code. That's expected now. The real opportunity? Everything else. Planning. Security. Compliance. Deployments. These are the bottlenecks that slow teams down every day. And they're wide open...

contests.title: Elasticsearch Agent Builder Hackathon
contests.description: About the challenge Welcome to the Elasticsearch Agent Builder Hackathon, running from January 22 to February 27, 2026. Build context-driven, multi-step AI agents that combine search, workflows, tools, and reasoning to automate real-world tasks. This isn‚Äôt about single prompt answers, it‚Äôs about agents that retrieve the most relevant context, select the right tools, and execute tasks across multiple steps. Your mission is to design agents that actually get work done. Compete for a share of $20,000 in prizes, collaborate with Elastic engineers, and get featured on our blog and social channels. We can‚Äôt wait to see the agents you develop Why participate ? Build agents for real work: Design agents that reason, use tools, keep context, and actually finish tasks. Level up fast: Practice multi-step reasoning, tool orchestration, and stateful workflows under real constraints. Win and get seen There is $20,000 on the table, plus exposure on blogs and social channels. What's Elasticsearch and Agent Builder Elasticsearch is an open source, distributed search and analytics engine built for speed, scale, and AI applications. As a retrieval platform, it stores structured, unstructured, and vector data in real time. It delivers fast hybrid and vector search, real-time analytics on logs, metrics or events, and enables AI-driven applications with high performance, accuracy, and relevance. Agent Builder is a framework to rapidly create custom agents that connect LLMs to private Elasticsearch data. Tailor tools to query indexes, trigger workflows, or use piped query language for logic, relevance, and personalization. It supports custom agents accessible via Kibana, APIs, MCP, and A2A.
contests.summary: About the challenge Welcome to the Elasticsearch Agent Builder Hackathon, running from January 22 to February 27, 2026. Build context-driven, multi-step AI agents that combine search, workflows, tools...

contests.title: DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI Hackathon
contests.description: WELCOME The DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI Hackathon challenges developers, builders, and creators to design and launch new, working AI-powered applications using DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI‚Äôs full-stack features. From model training to deployment, this hackathon is about shipping real, production-ready AI ‚Äî not just prototypes. Whether you‚Äôre exploring AI for the first time or scaling advanced machine learning workflows, this is your opportunity to build impactful applications on a developer-first cloud platform designed for speed, simplicity, and scale. Why join? Learn to build and deploy full-stack AI apps with DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI. Experiment with GPU-powered AI infrastructure and production-ready workflows. Compete for cash prizes and build something you can showcase. Get Started Signup for a DigitalOcean account! Check out the DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI documentation Check out DigitalOcean's general documentation About DigitalOcean DigitalOcean is the cloud built for developers. With powerful infrastructure, predictable pricing, and intuitive tools, DigitalOcean makes it easy for startups and growing teams to build, deploy, and scale applications without unnecessary complexity. About DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI DigitalOcean Gradient‚Ñ¢ AI is a full-stack AI platform that simplifies the entire machine learning lifecycle. With GPU-backed compute, flexible workflows, and seamless deployment, Gradient AI enables developers to move from idea to production faster all within DigitalOcean‚Äôs unified cloud ecosystem. In Partnership with Major League Hacking This hackathon is proudly supported by Major League Hacking (MLH), the global leader in developer hackathons. MLH empowers builders worldwide through inclusive, high-quality events and provides participants with access to resources, tooling, and community to help them succeed.

contests.title: Dev_Dash
contests.description: DevDash 2026: The Sprint to Solution DevDash 2026 is an intensive global innovation sprint designed to bridge the gap between abstract ideas and deployable technology. Whether you are a solo developer, a designer with a vision, or a startup team, DevDash provides the platform to showcase technical depth and creative problem-solving. This month-long hackathon emphasizes rapid iteration, usability, and impact. We aren't just looking for code; we‚Äôre looking for high-performance dashboards, tools, and systems that simplify complexity and drive real-world results. Get Started Register: Sign up on the DevDash portal to join the community. Form a Team: Connect with participants or go solo. Build: Develop your solution between Jan 20 and Feb 20. Submit: Ensure your project meets all technical and video requirements before the deadline.

contests.title: Byte 2 Beat
contests.description: Thank you for participating in Byte 2 Beat Important: To be eligible for prizes, you MUST Join our discord: https://discord.com/invite/SZhaZcNh4D. Aditionally, you must be a student (any grade is fine) Dataset: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1oTqMR3AM3FGjnAXPZZuqDLH7D4rcOhNbZ* *For 1st Place Projects, we would like you to find a unique dataset for more impactful and innovative projects and results. Cardiovascular Disease remains the leading cause of death globally. In this hackathon, you‚Äôll use real, de-identified biomedical data to build machine learning models that support early detection, progression forecasting, or interpretability of Cardiovascular Disease risk. Our goal: make serious computational health innovation accessible to every motivated high school or undergraduate student, no lab or insider network required. Hack4Health democratizes computational medicine by giving students access to authentic biomedical datasets, pragmatic tooling, and strong mentorship.

contests.title: Airia AI Agents Hackathon

contests.title: Hack for Humanity | 2026 (participation prizes!)
contests.description: About the challenge Hack for Humanity is a hackathon that brings technologists together in a 1-month event to come up with unique and creative solutions to enviornmental issues. The participants' goal is to use technology to make meaningful changes in humanity by helping save our environment. You may work individually or in teams of 2-4. Prior experience is not required! Participants of any skill level are welcome to participate and work together in this hackathon. Get started Join the Devpost hackathon on this page. This is where you will submit your project. We suggest you join our Discord server to stay updated and engage with the community (once you register). If you know someone else who may be interested, you could send them this URL and ask them to sign up: https://hack-for-humanity-26.devpost.com/. For every participant who joins the event and enters your username in the Discord server's "referral-raffle" text channel, your name will be entered into the raffle for the Referral Raffle. Any announcements will be posted on Discord.
